lead_paragraph: Despite advances in medicine, a longevity gap that has long favored wealthy Americans has more than doubled since the 1970s, researchers say.

headline.print_headline: Life Spans of the Rich Leave the Poor Behind
headline.main: Disparity in Life Spans of the Rich and the Poor Is Growing

snippet: Despite advances in medicine, a longevity gap that has long favored wealthy Americans has more than doubled since the 1970s, researchers say.
abstract: Brookings Institution study finds six-year difference in life expectancy between bottom 10 percent and top 10 percent of male earners born in 1920, and 14-year difference for male earners born in 1950; findings, which are alarming some public health experts and policy makers, bolster growing body of research that has shown longevity gap between Americans, based on income, widening sharply.
